concise_definition: n. 荣誉, 学分, 贷款, 字幕

definitions.explanation_en: A list of people who contributed to a film, television show, book, or other creative work, typically displayed at the beginning or end of the production.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在电影、电视节目、书籍或其他创意作品中参与制作的人员名单，通常显示在作品的开头或结尾。
definitions.example_en: The credits rolled slowly as the audience waited to see if there was a post-credits scene.
definitions.example_cn: 字幕缓缓滚动，观众等待着是否会有片尾彩蛋。

definitions.explanation_en: Academic units awarded for completing a course or program, used to measure progress toward a degree.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指完成一门课程或项目后所获得的学术学分，用于衡量获得学位的进展。
definitions.example_en: She needs 120 credits to graduate with a bachelor’s degree.
definitions.example_cn: 她需要修满120个学分才能获得学士学位。

definitions.explanation_en: Recognition or praise given to someone for their achievements or contributions.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因某人的成就或贡献而给予的赞誉或认可。
definitions.example_en: He deserves full credit for designing the successful marketing campaign.
definitions.example_cn: 他设计了成功的营销活动，理应获得全部赞誉。

definitions.explanation_en: An amount of money or financial value that is added to an account, often in contrast to a debit.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指存入账户的金额或财务价值，与借方（debit）相对。
definitions.example_en: My bank statement shows a credit of $500 from my salary deposit.
definitions.example_cn: 我的银行对账单显示了500美元的工资入账。

comparison.analysis: “Acknowledgment”（致谢）通常指在作品或文本中简短提及对他人帮助的感谢，形式较轻，不一定是正式名单；而 “credits” 是系统性、正式列出所有贡献者，常用于影视、出版等专业领域。
“Points”（分数/积分）常用于评分系统或游戏机制中，强调数量和累积；而 “credits” 在教育语境中特指官方认可的学术单位，具有制度性和规范性，不能随意替换。
“Debit”（借方）是财务术语，表示账户的支出或负债增加，与 “credit” 在会计中互为对立概念。虽然两者都属于金融记录，但 “credits” 作为名词复数时更常用于指代荣誉、学分或字幕，而非仅限于财务含义。
